definition: (of a rumor etc) to collapse (in the light of facts etc)/to be discredited
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: It can change material roller and collect materials automatically.
sentences.chinese: 它可以改變材料的壓路機和蒐集材料不攻自破。

sentences.english: Facts will eventually scotch these rumours.
sentences.chinese: 這種謠言在事實面前將不攻自破。

sentences.english: Virtual reality, and the time to check, flow well exposed.
sentences.chinese: 虛與實，時間以驗之，流蜚不攻自破也。

sentences.english: But on Thursday, the rumors are expected to meet a swift death.
sentences.chinese: 但是在週四，這些傳聞可能就會不攻自破。

sentences.english: And when you discover that, the wall itself often comes crumbling down before you.
sentences.chinese: 當了解這個道理的時候，這面牆常常會不攻自破。

sentences.english: But PTZ issue a tender, dispel speculation.
sentences.chinese: 但PTZ發佈招標後，傳聞不攻自破。

definition: clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
